answerText: jasmonates or jasmonic acids[10] Jasmonates also play a role in promoting senescence, which is inhibited by these other compounds, examples of which include kinetin and zeatin. Their primary function is to promote cell division.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | Finals 1 | 9 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These compounds can be synthesized via an octadecanoid intermediate through the LOX pathway from alpha-linolenic acid. For 10 points each: [10] Name these compounds which active proteinase inhibitors in response to wounds inflicted by small herbivores or fungi, thus mediating the immune response of a plant.
